rice.name: Rice
rice.description: Rice is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa and a staple food for much of the world's population.

maize.name: Maize
maize.description: Maize, also known as corn, is a cereal grain first domesticated by indigenous peoples in southern Mexico.

jute.name: Jute
jute.description: Jute is a long, soft, shiny vegetable fiber that can be spun into coarse, strong threads.

cotton.name: Cotton
cotton.description: Cotton is a soft, fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll around the seeds of cotton plants.

coconut.name: Coconut
coconut.description: The coconut tree is a member of the palm tree family, and its fruit is widely used in food and non-food products.

papaya.name: Papaya
papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit, known for its sweet taste and high vitamin C content.

orange.name: Orange
orange.description: Oranges are round citrus fruits with a tough orange skin and sweet, juicy segments inside.

apple.name: Apple
apple.description: Apples are sweet, edible fruits produced by an apple tree (Malus domestica).

muskmelon.name: Muskmelon
muskmelon.description: Muskmelons are sweet, aromatic fruits with a soft, juicy interior and a firm, smooth skin.

watermelon.name: Watermelon
watermelon.description: Watermelon is a large, juicy fruit with a thick rind and sweet, red flesh containing many seeds.

grapes.name: Grapes
grapes.description: Grapes are small, round, smooth-skinned berries that grow in clusters and are used to make wine, juice, and raisins.

mango.name: Mango
mango.description: Mangoes are tropical stone fruits known for their sweetness, flavor, and nutritional value.

banana.name: Banana
banana.description: Bananas are long, curved fruits that grow in clusters and are a staple food in many tropical countries.

pomegranate.name: Pomegranate
pomegranate.description: Pomegranates are a fruit known for their rich, red seeds that are packed with juice.

lentil.name: Lentil
lentil.description: Lentils are small, lens-shaped legumes that are high in protein and essential nutrients.

blackgram.name: Blackgram
blackgram.description: Blackgram (Urad Dal) is a legume grown for its seeds, which are used in cooking in many cultures.

mungbean.name: Mungbean
mungbean.description: Mungbean is a small green legume grown primarily for sprouting or for consumption in soups and curries.

mothbeans.name: Mothbeans
mothbeans.description: Mothbean is a drought-resistant legume grown primarily in arid regions.

pigeonpeas.name: Pigeonpeas
pigeonpeas.description: Pigeonpea is a drought-tolerant legume grown for its seeds, which are a source of protein.

kidneybeans.name: Kidneybeans
kidneybeans.description: Kidney beans are large, dark red legumes used in various dishes worldwide.

chickpea.name: Chickpea
chickpea.description: Chickpeas, also known as garbanzo beans, are small, round legumes that are high in protein.

coffee.name: Coffee
coffee.description: Coffee is a brewed beverage made from roasted coffee beans, known for its stimulating effect due to caffeine.
